story:
Once upon a time, in a lush green forest in Thailand, there lived a kind and gentle elephant named Em. Em was the biggest and strongest elephant in the forest, but she was also the most loving and caring. She had a beautiful long trunk, which she used to help other animals in the forest.

One day, a little bird named Bing fell from her nest and hurt her wing. Em saw the little bird lying on the ground, struggling to fly. With her gentle and caring nature, Em picked Bing up with her trunk and took her to her home in the forest.

Em made a soft bed for Bing with leaves and branches and took care of her with love and kindness. She fed Bing with berries and insects and made sure she had enough water to drink. Em even sang lullabies to Bing every night to help her sleep.

Days turned into weeks, and Bing's wing started to heal. Em was happy to see Bing getting better, but she knew that Bing missed her family and wanted to fly back to them. Em decided to help Bing fly back to her nest.

Em made a sling with her strong and sturdy trunk and tied Bing to it gently. She then started to run through the forest, flapping her big ears to create a breeze. Bing felt the wind in her wings and gradually started to flap them harder and harder.

After a while, Bing was strong enough to fly on her own. Em was overjoyed to see her little friend flying again. Bing flew around Em, chirping happily, and then flew back to her nest.

Em felt a sense of happiness and fulfillment, knowing that she had helped her little friend. From that day on, Bing and Em became the best of friends, and Em was always there to help any animal in need.

And so, the story of Em teaches us the importance of kindness, love, and caring for others. Goodnight, my dear child. May you always be as kind and loving as Em. Sweet dreams!
